WRITING.TEXT: High winds perhaps, seems the trailer took one heck of a knock. Quick thinking of the driver who was able to do that balancing act.

One thing i found as I've gotten older is that your perception of time does indeed change with age. Being in my early 30's i find that a year can go by in a blink of an eye where as in my early 20's time seemed to go at a snails pace. I remember reading a paper once where research had gone into this and your age does play an important role. For example when you're 20 you'l feel like the last 10 years behind you was a heck of a long time. That's because it was half of your life span at that time. In regards to the simulated universe theory and Mandela Effects I feel that is an entirely separate but disturbing issue. https://www.scientificamerican.com/article/why-does-time-seem-to-speed-up-with-age/

Good lord this sounds like an unnerving experience. Have you had any problems before with your short term memory? Are you often forgetful? One thing i would consider if i were you is keeping a journal. Just make a note of every time you get up out of bed, write down the time. Do the same for when you go to bed also. Check it now and again to see if there are any discrepancies.

I'm a firm believer in that time isn't as linear as we are lead to believe. I think sometimes in our lives the system glitches and we have ourselves a bit of a time "hiccup". Failing that maybe your wife doubled back on herself and came back into the kitchen a second time?

WRITING.TITLE: JFK Mandela Effect - 4 seat Lincoln vs 6 Seat
WRITING.TEXT: Out of all of the different Mandela Effects that have come to light over the last couple of years the biggest one for me is in regards to the assassination of John F. Kennedy. When i was in high school back in the late 1990s each class we took in our final year gave us an assignment to do. The assignment was important because it contributed to your final grade upon graduation. In history i decided to do a report of JFK. I wanted to write about the sort of man he was as well as a president. Back in those days the internet was still fairly new and google non-existent so i decided it best to visit the School's library and check out the encyclopedia which came on a swanky CD ROM. The moment i typed in JFK into the search bar my school computer screen was full of pictures, texts, Sound bites of the president talking and pictures of a 4 Seat Lincoln Car. I was surprised to find it also included a grainy quicktime video of the president's last moments. I remember it as the president being hit, reaching for his neck and slumping down, the driver looking back to the president briefly and then an explosion as the president was no more. I remembering being almost traumatised by what my young mind was seeing. I remember for days after not being able to get the images out of my head, images of Jackie Kennedy crawling towards the back end of the Lincoln and all hell breaking loose. Fast forward a few years and i remember seeing a conspiracy video online that suggested that the driver, upon seeing Kennedy was still alive after the first shot fired a pistol from underneath his own arm. The video was slowed down and analysed. I didn't buy into the theory. Fast forward to now and seeing this 6 seat Lincoln driving through Dallas carrying an extra two occupants between the Kennedys and the driver just really screws with my mind. For one the car just looks wrong, its not the car i remember from those old quicktime videos. Also how could the driver in that conspiracy video fire a gun with another man sitting right behind him in the way of the president? Out of all the Mandela Effects this is the one that bother's me the most because of how much time I contributed to the facts of that day. Does anyone else remember the 4 Seat Lincoln or the conspiracy video?
It #8217;s probably a bit too graphic to be posting here?

When i was young my grandfather would sit me down and tell me stories of WW2, he was a British paratrooper. When he noticed I was really interested he gave me books to read and I couldn #8217;t get enough, partly because I love history but more so that I have a need to understand human behaviour. Why, as humans do we have the capacity for such cruelty. I #8217;ve read so many testimonies from holocaust survivors and it hurts my heart every time. To loose so much. I don #8217;t think I #8217;ll ever understand how it was allowed to happen. I understand how compartilisaion works and how many nazi soldiers claimed they were only doing #8220;their jobs #8221; or #8220;following orders #8221; but surely there had to be some who realised the extent of what they were apart of?

A devastating mine explosion that I have no memory of.
WRITING.TEXT: Back in 2013 I had my first unexplainable discrepancy happen. I live in a small village in South Wales, UK and history was always my favourite subject growing up. One day as I was getting ready for work my partner mentioned that it was an anniversary of some mine explosion disaster that happened a hundred years prior, back when my village was a mining village and coal was all the rage. I laughed, suddenly feeling like my old lady had gone a little funny. As I said it #8217;s a small village, history is well known and well taught here, she might as well have said something like #8220;it #8217;s the anniversary of the nazi #8217;s winning WW2 #8221; I turned on the TV and sure enough there it was on BBC Wales, some old guy sitting opposite an interviewer showing old black and white newspaper prints all about the disaster. How the explosion took out 439 miners in an instant, families losing fathers and sons, the whole village becoming full of widows in one morning. It was heartbreaking to see. I told my partner that I had no recollection of this happening and she looked at me as if I was the weird one. #8220;We walk past the memorial every time we walk the dogs? #8221; She took me down the road and there it was, this big black cylindrical monument with names of all the people who perished. Id never seen this memorial before. Till this day she still believes I #8217;m winding her up, she can #8217;t fathom how I could forget such a big part of our village #8217;s history. But I #8217;d never heard about it, never heard anyone speak of it until that morning.

WRITING.TITLE: A devastating mine explosion that I have no memory of.
WRITING.TEXT: Back in 2013 I had my first unexplainable discrepancy happen. I live in a small village in South Wales, UK and history was always my favourite subject growing up. One day as I was getting ready for work my partner mentioned that it was an anniversary of some mine explosion disaster that happened a hundred years prior, back when my village was a mining village and coal was all the rage. I laughed, suddenly feeling like my old lady had gone a little funny. As I said it #8217;s a small village, history is well known and well taught here, she might as well have said something like #8220;it #8217;s the anniversary of the nazi #8217;s winning WW2 #8221; I turned on the TV and sure enough there it was on BBC Wales, some old guy sitting opposite an interviewer showing old black and white newspaper prints all about the disaster. How the explosion took out 439 miners in an instant, families losing fathers and sons, the whole village becoming full of widows in one morning. It was heartbreaking to see. I told my partner that I had no recollection of this happening and she looked at me as if I was the weird one. #8220;We walk past the memorial every time we walk the dogs? #8221; She took me down the road and there it was, this big black cylindrical monument with names of all the people who perished. Id never seen this memorial before. Till this day she still believes I #8217;m winding her up, she can #8217;t fathom how I could forget such a big part of our village #8217;s history. But I #8217;d never heard about it, never heard anyone speak of it until that morning.

How the area looked before the monument was erected (pre 2006) is how it always looked until that day in 2013. I mean for me at least. I remember thinking that surely i would have noticed an unavailing of this memorial back in 2006, i was very close to the area at the time. I don't know, i think the only reason I've managed to deal with all of this is by flat out ignoring it and just getting on with things. I mean I know i'm not that ignorant. I knew the history of my village (or so i thought), i knew about near by similar mine disasters. I spoke to my father about it and he was just as surprised. Asked how could i forget something that took out so many of my ancestors.

What happens to actors in your lucid dream?
WRITING.TEXT: Sound like a dumb question I know but I had a dream last night where I became lucid and started walking around this office building. As I was walking up a set of stairs I was passing people on various landings, people I didn #8217;t recognise and were only too happy to greet me with a smile or a nod. As I made my way up further I was looking down from time to time over the banister to see these people moving off the landing and then through various doors. I paused aware this was a dream, and slowly made my way back down and peered through one of the doors to see these people just standing there frozen in spot. Almost as if they were character NPCs in a video game that #8217;s run their course and has now shut down. I inspected these #8220;statues #8221; and they slowly started to dissolve, as they went transparent and vanished.
